page.title: 07FARMS NEAR PETERSFIELD 2
page.content:
{Soal}farm has mainly grassland. It also has root crops, oilseed rape, barley, hay and silage. The farm has 350 bacon pigs and l04 piglets. The pigs are cleaned out once a day. In winter they sleep inside buildings and in summer in open pens. When the piglets are born the pigs and piglets stay inside. When the pigs are old enough they are sent to market at Chichester or Guildford.
At{Broadwood}farm Mr. Cook has about 200 beef cattle. He has 60 acres of grassland with 11 fields to keep his cattle in. He has just bought some new 4-month old calves. They live in the fields. When they are old enough they will go to Petersfield Meat Company to be slaughtered.
